page.title: 04ECOLOGY IN BRAMSHAW AREA
page.content: {HABITAT.}Deciduous & conifer woodlands as well as heathland & bogland. There is also some arable land in the area, mostly near farms & houses. {POLLUTION.}The area is largely free from the use of toxic chemicals. This has assisted healthy plant & wild life The FC has embarked on a programme to protect the Forest against damage by too many people, cars & campers. 5 car parks & 1 camping site are provided in this area.Vehicular access to parts of the Forest is prevented by barriers, ditches & short wooden posts. There is a litter problem which is nationwide. There is also concern about the number of visitors to the Forest. {FOOTPATHS}In addition to the many paths & tracks on FC land there are 9 public footpaths in the area.
